Despite mixed reviews impacting walk-ins, the film has amassed ₹66.65 crore in its first three days, with its long-term success now hinging on weekend and weekday collections.

Traditionally, presidents wear American flag pins.

title: Why Nasa is bringing 4 astronauts home from ISS before scheduled return
description: A medical issue has prompted NASA astronauts on the International Space Station to cut their mission short. The Crew-11 spacecraft is set to undock soon, with a splashdown planned off California's coast. While the crew member is stable, details remain undisclosed. This unexpected departure means one astronaut will stay behind to ensure a US presence.

description: Calcutta High Court witnessed significant disruption Friday as a hearing concerning the Enforcement Directorate's actions against Mamata Banerjee's party consultancy was postponed. Justice Suvra Ghosh adjourned proceedings until January 14 due to "enormous disturbance and commotion" from lawyers and apprentices.  The judge cited a lack of decorum, stating the courtroom environment was unsuitable for a hearing.

Cybercrime gang busted in Bihar; scammers offered men Rs 10L to impregnate women
description: A cybercrime gang in Nawada district was busted for a fraudulent scheme promising young men Rs10 lakh to impregnate women. Operating under fake job and service names, they collected registration fees before vanishing. Police arrested two main suspects involved in this and other scams, seizing incriminating evidence.

title: Greenland, Iran, Colombia? Who's next on Donald Trump's bombing radar
description: President Trump's 'Donroe Doctrine' has reshaped global politics, marked by aggressive military actions in Venezuela, Iran, and beyond. While seeking peace, he simultaneously orchestrates interventions, eyeing territories like Greenland and Mexico. This dual approach, blending diplomacy with forceful assertion, places numerous nations under a shadow of potential US military engagement.

title: Google cofounders Sergey Brin and Larry Page 'cutting ties' with America's Silicon Valley
description: Google co-founders Sergey Brin and Larry Page have moved a key entity out of California to Delaware, ahead of a potential 5% wealth tax. This move, with Reno, Nevada listed as the principal office, comes as the state considers a retroactive tax on billionaires.

title: Corey Perry exits Kings after being placed on non-roster status
description: Los Angeles Kings veteran Corey Perry has stepped away from the team after being placed on non-roster status due to a family-related illness. The decision prompted emergency roster moves from the Ontario Reign as the Kings adjusted during the 2025–26 NHL season, with Perry’s leadership and production temporarily absent from the lineup.

title: Stefon Diggs–Cardi B drama becomes Patriots playoff distraction
description: The New England Patriots are winning, but celebrity drama, particularly involving Stefon Diggs and Cardi B, overshadows their on-field success. While quarterback Drake Maye shows promise, Diggs' crucial role in the offense is undeniable. Coach Mike Vrabel attempts to maintain focus amidst the off-field noise, but the team's playoff hopes hinge on managing these distractions.

title: Candace Owens sparks new Charlie Kirk questions after unseen image surfaces
description: Candace Owens shared claims about a photo she says shows Charlie Kirk after an alleged shooting. She questioned the official story and named people she said could not be trusted. However, there is no verified evidence, police record, or official confirmation that Charlie Kirk was shot or killed. Her statements remain unproven and widely disputed.
